snippet: Activision Blizzard, which sells must-have video games like those in the Call of Duty series, may be admired by Wall Street, but players often lash out at the chief executive, Bobby Kotick.
abstract: Profile of Activision Blizzard CEO Bobby Kotick, who has earned the admiration of Wall Street by transforming the video game publisher into an industry titan; Kotick found success by focusing on a small number of must-have blockbusters, but he remains personally unpopular among some gamers who feel he does not fit the profile of an enthusiast.
lead_paragraph: Activision Blizzard, which sells must-have video games like those in the Call of Duty series, may be admired by Wall Street, but players often lash out at the chief executive, Bobby Kotick.

headline.seo: Bobby Kotick of Activision, Drawing Praise and Wrath
headline.main: At Activision, a Hero and Villain, Zapped Into One
headline.print_headline: Hero and Villain, Zapped Into One
